website_summaries.verdict: The Epson Perfection V700 Photo makes an excellent choice for a deep-pocketed photo hobbyist or a pro who needs to scan originals in a mixture of sizes.
cons: driver has some annoying interface quirks
frequently pauses in midscan to warm up

website_summaries.verdict: Aiming to attract serious amateur photographers, the Epson Perfection V700 has comprehensive options for handling film and produces top-quality scans.
pros: High-quality scans for photographic prints and film
Modes range from full auto to full control over settings
cons: Minimal optical character recognition (OCR) and document-management capability

customer_reviews.title: Use in professional archives
customer_reviews.text: I replaced both our old flatbed scanner and slide-and-negative scanner with this one. I needed this because we have many oversized negatives - 3"x4" / 4"x5" / 8"x10". This does them all - and superbly! Since our computer has Win 7 on it, I located the newer drivers and installed them; I didn't even bother with the disc that came with the scanner. I simply "Twain" from Photoshop (using the Import command) and get absolutely wonderful scans of photos, negatives and slides. I even checked out using this on some of our old Ambrotype photos (glass plate positives) with excellent results. I can't say enough good things about this scanner!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Epson Perfection V700 Photo Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this photo scanner to scan in a few thousand 35 mm slides. The scanner worked flawlessly!! The SILVERFAST software that came with the scanner was very disappointing. I used the EPSON scan software and was very satisfied with it. The scanner slide holders were very well designed and worked great. The EPSON scanner software knew whether I had one or twelve slides. A great feature. I then used the supplied ADOBE Photoshop Element nine to enhance the slides. Very happy with the scanner. Would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I deliberated a while before getting this scanner, comparing reviews for other Epson and Canon scanners. So far I am really impressed. Have used it mainly to scan 6x6 and 4x5 negs and trannies, also positive images. Really happy with the results. The only limitation to resolution is my internal memory. The Epson, Silverlight and Abbyy OCR software - all of which are included - are impressive. Both the Epson and Silverlight take a little tweaking - I have not yet fully fathomed all they may be capable of. I love this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Caitriona Reed

customer_reviews.title: Excellent photo scanner
customer_reviews.text: I decided at the last minute to upgrade from the V600 to the V700 once I saw the extra film and negative holders included in the V700. Wow, I can scan 12 35MM slides at one time, although it does take awhile. Love that it creates a separate file for each slide, even though it scans all 12 slides at once. The ICE software removed the dust marks, etc. I didn't have to do much touch-up in Photoshop afertwards. Simple to install and load the software. I researched photo scanners for about 6 months and am very pleased I spend the extra dollars for this one. Amazing quality.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scanner
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased this scanner, I was using a Polaroid 1600 dpi slide scanner. I found I had to spend considerable time in Photoshop adjusting the color, brightness & contrast. After reading several reviews of the Epson V700 scanner, I purchased it. I'm blown away by the quality of the scans of slides on Full Auto mode and don't have to make any adjustment. I haven't used it to scan photographs or text yet, but would expect similar results.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B

customer_reviews.title: Scans slides like a boss
customer_reviews.text: I have several hundred slides from the 50's on Kodachrome. This thing scans them like a boss. They snap into the provided tray, and I use Vuescan to turn those mothers into JPEGs for me. It's like the best thing ever. The quality is absolutely gorgeous. The slide scans look like they were taken with a DSLR (a cheap one, though, with a kit lens) yesterday. Get it if you have a big scanning project to do. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with epson v700
customer_reviews.text: Initially I had trouble getting the scanner to work but a quick Call to epson cleared up the matter. There is a lock on the scanning bed to protect it during shipment. I was not aware that there were 2 switches which had to be moved in order for the bed to be unlocked. Once both switches were moved the scanner worked like a charm. I bought it to scan 4x5 negatives and it does a great job and the price on amazon was $100 less than any place else.
customer_reviews.author: tbone

customer_reviews.title: great investment
customer_reviews.text: solid scanner, works well with small format up to large format (4x5). plastic negative guides don't inspire a lot of confidence, but this does 98% of the job. anything else send it into LCS and have it drum-scanned. i use this as an alternative to printing contact sheets. in fact, since i shoot mostly B&W film, i develop my own rolls, then scan with this: a nice hybrid workflow.
customer_reviews.author: melgart

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic scanner... buy different software
customer_reviews.text: Amazing incredible scanner. I haven't begun to explore all its capabilities and features, but it hasn't disappointed yet. BTW if you have Mac Lion you'll have to jump through some hoops to download the Lion-compatible version of the included OEM version of Silverfast scanning software. The OEM version is not the top of the Silverfast line, so I don't have a direct comparison, but in the end I went and bought the pro version of VueScan, which seems to me a more powerful and precise tool than OEM Silverfast.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for large negatives
customer_reviews.text: Very nice scanner for large transparent film. I purchased this scanner to scan some WWII era negatives my grandfather took while in the south pacific. It worked great. Many of the negatives I have do not fit the film holders that come with the scanner. I have detailed how to work around this on my blog at johnfixesstuff.blogspot.com, search for epson v700 to find the post.
customer_reviews.author: John Mueller

customer_reviews.title: The best in this category
customer_reviews.text: This is the best you can get outside of a dedicated film scanner that is no longer produced, supported by software, or just too expensive. I needed something for making contact sheets, scanning 120 and 135 film and it does everything very well. I scan all my film and don't really notice much lack of sharpness when comparing the original slides for example to the scans. Getting the right settings is key - I just use epson scan as that is what I am used to. I uncheck everything and adjust the histogram to avoid any clipping then adjust the individual color levels in Photoshop.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob A Cecil

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, great price
customer_reviews.text: A top photo scanner at an amazing price (timing is everything). Have been using it for almost a month and it is simply fantastic. Dual lenses for different jobs, Very high res scans, easy to use. Highly recommended (if you have a lot of slides, negs and prints like me). And Amazon had it on my front porch in 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Epson v700 (for dental use)
customer_reviews.text: This scanner was recommended by a Dexis Dental imaging specialist as a more affordable option to digitalizing dental panorex xray images without purchasing a $35,000 digital pano machine. It took a little experimenting, but now this scanner can replicate panorex xrays simply by laying the film directly on the glass and clickig two buttons. My digital imaging software recognizes the formats and even allows manipulation of the image if needed. Excellent product, great scans, Only dig I have is that there is very little info in the manual about xrays, but if all uses of this scanner were to be fully discussed in the manual, the thng would be 1000 pages long. Buy it !!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Kline

customer_reviews.title: but this is by far the best in home scanner for negatives
customer_reviews.text: Had to fix a could things that came loose in shipping, but had worked wonders in scanning hundreds of old 4x5 wide format negatives. I have always preferred Epson scanners, but this is by far the best in home scanner for negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Skapunker82

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Scan, for less then a Drum Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased the Epson Perfection V700 Photo Color Scanner a few weeks ago, to scan 4 x 5 negatives. I needed them to be at a higher resolution because I have the images printed on glass at 4 ft x 5 ft. This scanner is efficient enough to complete such a task. It is very helpful that you can scan not only 35mm and 120 film but medium format as well. I would recommend this scanner to anyone that scans film as a professional photographer, for print. This is not an item that would be worth the investment in though, if you are just scanning old high school photos for your 10 year reunion.
customer_reviews.author: Rowynn

customer_reviews.title: Fast, sharp, and steadfast.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful scanner. I still can't get over shooting film, I love my film cameras too much, and to get anything comparable in the digital range is out of my price range and fancy. This thing does a wonderful job and allows me to be digital while I am still analog.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Severud

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up for the Mac!
customer_reviews.text: No major review, just to say that it worked right out of the box on my Mac (Quad-Core) and was no trouble to install, configure and use. Scans previews very quickly, and final scans are also fast and good quality. I use it for documents, photos, some slides. Image prep for websites and archiving paperwork for the files. Would recommend this one. Only drawback is large physical size, so be sure you have room for it on the desk if you plan to leave it out.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Difference between sub-$200 and this baby
customer_reviews.text: The obvious difference between this $500+ vs sub-$200 scanners is better construction and much longer bulb life. I bought this model for scanning mainly family photos but it much more capable than just that. Epson's own scanning app is easy to use and UI are easy to understand. The free Silverfast scanning app work fine until it crashed during a cancelled scan. For unknown reason after the crash, it won't accept registration again. Which is fine...I can live with out it. I gave this scanner a four star because this kind of quality used to cost over $1000 in semi-pro range for professional usage. Granted it's no drum scan, but that would be a total overkill.
customer_reviews.author: BookGenius

customer_reviews.title: Great for Our Dads' Old Slides
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner for my Dad's old slides. Get Vuescan shareware software to operate the scanner (PC, Mac, Linux). It has great automatic adjustment of old faded slide colors. I recommend lightly tapping the slide holder on two edges to get the slides to consistently line up with the positions of the slide images in the previous scan.
customer_reviews.author: Walter McCannon

customer_reviews.title: Great... and overcomplicated.
customer_reviews.text: The required software (to get the full functionality) is overcomplicated, not user friendly to my wife, who generally understands computers and is a Photoshop user. But it does a great job on old photos, and I've used it on over-sized negatives and gotten great results. Scanning, hardware, speed, color, all GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Crandall

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty reliably, but the software takes forever to "warm up". Good quality images, though.
customer_reviews.author: NorseSwede

customer_reviews.title: Epson Perfection is good
customer_reviews.text: Some of the other reviews frightened me a little and it was with apprehension that I opened the box, installed the software and plugged in the scanner. Since my slides had not arrived I dragged out some old negatives for practice. WOW.... Easy, Good, Better than I dreamed. I only used mid level scans as the neg's were not in good shape, will increase resoultion when I start the slides.
customer_reviews.author: Arkaty

customer_reviews.title: awesome scanner
customer_reviews.text: I also have the Nikon CoolScan V. This machine works wonders on my old photos and even new stuff! I have scanned 110 film (with an adapter), 35mm, and a number of old pictures for a project I'm doing with my family to digitize all our old stuff. Everyone loves the results. The Epson software is all you need. The SilverScan stuff is too hard to use and the results weren't as good without significant, time consuming tweaking.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Murray

customer_reviews.title: This is one great scanner as long as you don't need a legal ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one great scanner as long as you don't need a legal size copy. I haven't used the film scanning functions as I already have a dedicated film scanner but it does a great job on photos and I use it for everyday document scanning.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wickham

customer_reviews.title: Epson B11B178011 Perfection V700 Photo Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the scanner for our priinting business and home photo and slide scans. Extremely pleased with ease of use and quality of black and white and color prints and negative and positive transparencies. Would recommend to business and home use purchasers.
customer_reviews.author: LL89

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: While this scanner is quite expensive it really delivers. However the included SilverFast software is extremely difficult to operate and, in my mind, not worth the cost added to the scanner package. I do not accept the supposed claim that the software is "free."
customer_reviews.author: pmlofft

customer_reviews.title: great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line; I am not a professional photographer. I wanted a scanner to digitalize slides, photos, and negatives. The V500 seems to do that. I loaded the Silverfast dvd and it seems over my head at this time. Any enhancing of the photos I do with iPhoto and that seems to work at this time. Maybe in the future I will use Silverfast. I have found that sometimes photos age better than negatives and slides. I am having fun learning to digitalize. The V700 is doing well by me. A good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Don T. Hun

customer_reviews.title: A Scanner Above
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is excellent and handles both color as well as black and White. It has Excellent Resolution for any project. I use for plain old B&W to color and 35M slides.
customer_reviews.author: Claude

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Easy to use. Works splendidly and the frames for the negs are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Matheis

customer_reviews.title: Epson Perfection V700 Photo Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Solid, heavy scanner. Great to have a stand-alone scanner. It allows me to scan photos when ink runs out on my all-in-one HP printer/scanner. The slide holders are flimsy, but usable. They probably will last if handled with care. It's too early to judge overall scanner durability. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Titan

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner to digatize old photos and slides. I think it does a great job. It's pretty putzie to go through all the steps to get the scans if you want high quality. Batch scan, frame, zoom to get frame exactly right, adjust color/exposure/contrast/repair/etc. and then final scan. The frames for slides works well and you can do 12 at a time. High quality scanner that fits the bill for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Reliable Scanner
customer_reviews.text: We have had one of these scanners for years and recently needed two for a bog project. There was no question what we would buy. This Epson Perfection V700 is just as fast, reliable and high quality as the first one we bought.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: seems as good as the one that cost 1600 for dental films. Very pleased with resolution.
customer_reviews.author: LEE

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product; impressive results
customer_reviews.text: An amazing product, easy to use with impressive results. The ability to individual adjust the scanning properties of each slide/negative allows customization to yield excellent outcomes. Plus it is fast. More effort than sending your slides off to be processed, but a lot more control over the quality of the final product. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: lollygagger

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Love all the film templates and how fast it is. The scans are clean and clear and the unit is very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Erin McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the quality of both
customer_reviews.text: Used both for scanning photographs and slides. Very pleased with the quality of both.
customer_reviews.author: Nayajja

customer_reviews.title: Epson Perfection V700 Photo Color Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this machine. I was needing a contact printer for all my old negatives of every size and shape. I now have it. The V700 is even better than my old enlarger style set up. I can set the resolution to what ever I want which I could not do before. I highly recommend this product to all the old enlarger buffs out there.
customer_reviews.author: Charles I. Freitas

customer_reviews.title: Great for organizing photos
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, easy to use. It has been a great tool so far. I am scanning old family photographs, slides and negatives. It has worked great. Only negative is the speed and size (takes up a lot of space on the desk). I use it with an Imac and have had no problems!
customer_reviews.author: C. Ervin

customer_reviews.title: Fast Delivery
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for the over night delivery. I love the V700 scanner it is a lot faster than my 4870 photo scanner. Everything is working OK at this time.
customer_reviews.author: David Emory

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good scanner
customer_reviews.text: The age and potential cost of repair for my first Epson Photo Scanner prompted me to purchase the V700. I felt the first one was good, the new V700 is even better. Setup was easy, and I am very pleased with the quality of the documents and photos that I've scanned so far. While I haven't done any negatives yet, prior experience with Epson leads me to believe that the negatives will scan to high quality photos as well. I would recommend the V700 for anyone wanting good quality scans.
customer_reviews.author: Larry C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our oral surgery practice to scan xrays. It is easy to use and integrates seamlessly with our practice software.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Havenor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this scanner it works terrific and my scanned art work turn out great! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Mixed Media Artist

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner to replace one that was several years old. I have used it to scan many negatives and slides and it has met all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate. Does just what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: s clark

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scanner. IT does more negatives at once then most other scanners. And has great image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nightwolf

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scanner for home use, we scan docs and pictures. There are lots of choices in the program. We also got several negative and slide holders for ease of digitizing albums.
customer_reviews.author: Fred the computer guy

customer_reviews.title: Epson made a big mistake with this one.
customer_reviews.text: This scanner does NOT come with software that can calibrate it. It will cost you $270 to upgrade to the software that will. Biggest waste of my money. Regret buying this scanner, and didn't find this out until after I could not return it to amazon.com. All my scans come out bluish green, and it stinks having to manually change every image (especially when calibrating it would rid it of this problem).
customer_reviews.author: CHS

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Positive: Converts negatives and positives into digital photos very easily. Recognizes more than one photo on the scanner and creates a separate image. The included software is excellent especially Adobe Elements. Set up is very easy. Tech support at Epson is very good. Negative: Price - a bit high, but I think worth it. Software setup had a very old driver. Required download of the current driver after a call to tech support. Takes time to convert negatives/postive slides to photos (but worth it).
customer_reviews.author: glfgryhwk

customer_reviews.title: 4 x 5 film and above!
customer_reviews.text: If you want the ability to scan to scan large format film then this is the scanner. I highly reccomend this over the V500 only because of this capability.
customer_reviews.author: VPAS

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for video work and photography
customer_reviews.text: Scanner was everything I needed, and i like epson I used a perfection 2400 for 12 years and I bet I have done thousands of scans on it and I expect better from this one
customer_reviews.author: Videogal

customer_reviews.title: Love this scanner
customer_reviews.text: We use this scanner in a dental office for scanning x rays and it works great. It is fast and easy to use and we recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Sockolosky

customer_reviews.title: epson v700
customer_reviews.text: The epson is perfect for my medium format scans which always me to get the best detail of my negative.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive scanner for larger negatives
customer_reviews.text: I needed to scan larger negatives and this scanner had great reviews. It took me a long time to take the plunge, but I love it! I help produce steam train photo books and our customers often rave about the quality of the photos.
customer_reviews.author: SST

customer_reviews.title: An excellent flatbed scanner
customer_reviews.text: The Epson V700 has met or exceeded my expectations. I recommend it without reservation, something I am usually reluctant to do.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H. Davis

customer_reviews.title: One happy customer.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the results of scanning slides. I haven't tried anything else, but the slides are very good. Just 7,000 to go.
customer_reviews.author: sooner fanz

customer_reviews.title: ... slides and I have found this scanner both fairly easy to use and capable of delivering excellent results in ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for scanning slides and I have found this scanner both fairly easy to use and capable of delivering excellent results in digitizing one's slide collection.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Erben

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner, poor software
customer_reviews.text: This scanner comes with Laserfast's "Silverfast SE" It was impossible to install the latter inspite of help from tech reps on line and on the phone. Fortunatly it has the Epson software also which works well but does not offer some of the things that made me elect this scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Alan M. Blank

customer_reviews.title: WOnderful scanner
customer_reviews.text: THis has great resolution, easy to set up and use. Was just what I needed and performed as advertised. Highly recomended!
customer_reviews.author: MarkB

customer_reviews.title: Unpacked and set up and scan arm wouldn't move. ...
customer_reviews.text: Unpacked and set up and scan arm wouldn't move. Just clicked and hung up every time. On its way back...
customer_reviews.author: NiteOwl

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner, not such a good company
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is pretty good, but Epson no longer deserves a high reputation as a company. They advertise, for example, that your package includes Adobe Photoshop Elements, but what you get is Elements version 3, which has been obsolete for 3 years! Elements 6 is the current version. And,if you check their website there is no provision to make general contact to register a complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Harry T. Dubetz

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed !
customer_reviews.text: Product failed almost immediately after we bought it and installed. Was past the 30 days to return to Amazon. epson support was not able to solve the problem and now we have to take it to a service center. Have owned Epson printers in the past and they were fine. This scanner was one of the most disappointing electronic products ever owned , and one of the biggest disappointments from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: David A. Wilson, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not good- constantly warming up
customer_reviews.text: Epson discontinued it's 1680 scanner and this seemed to be it's replacement. I'm not sure if the one I received was broken, but it stalled for 1 minute to "warm up" every time you changed between reflective to transmissive scan methods. The 1680 did not do this. Maybe I'm in the minority, but my normal usage is to scan a document, then 1 or more associated transmissive images. This was a show stopper for me, so back it went.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D.

customer_reviews.title: Epson V700
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, fast, quiet. A vast improvement over my old scanner.
customer_reviews.author: D. G. Christian

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great Scanner. Does add a a slight color cast to thee images that are easily adjusted in a software application.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Dee CF

customer_reviews.title: Best scanner under $400.00
customer_reviews.text: Highest quality scanner from Epson for Mac and Windows computers. Make your 30-40 year old color slides come to life once again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Dubiel

customer_reviews.title: top of the line...
customer_reviews.text: best unit just below the pro. level...great for the sau about average person....needs..
customer_reviews.author: James C. Foote

customer_reviews.title: Nice scanner
customer_reviews.text: It is not easy to use it but scan resolution is above what I expected. slide carrier is already broken.
customer_reviews.author: jenny

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing scanner
customer_reviews.text: It is almost impossible to get the scanner to communicate with the computer. Installation instructions are very brief and inadequate, especially regarding drivers for the Vista OS, and illustrations lack detail. I can't comment on the quality of the scans because after 3 days of trying I still can't get the thing to work!
customer_reviews.author: FGB

product_meta.title: Epson B11B178011 Perfection V700 Photo Scanner
product_meta.description:
Get professional quality results from virtually any photographic original with the Epson Perfection V700 photo scanner. With groundbreaking 6400 DPI resolution, the powerful scanner consistantly delivers precision color and detail, whether scanning slides, negatives, or medium-format film. With a 4.0 DMax, it offers exceptional image quality, excellent detail in shadow areas and remarkable tonal range.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From the Manufacturer Get professional quality results from virtually any photographic original with the Epson Perfection V700 Photo Scanner. With groundbreaking 6,400 dpi resolution, this powerful scanner consistently delivers precision color and detail, whether scanning slides, negatives or medium–format film. With a 4.0 Dmax optical resolution, it offers exceptional image quality, excellent detail in shadow areas and remarkable tonal range. 48–bit color and 16–bit grayscale provide subtle shades and accurate color reproduction for everything from professional slides to simple business documents.




Epson Perfection V700 Scanner with built–in 8" x 10" transparency unit


6400 x 9600 dpi resolution for film enlargements up to 17" x 22"






The Epson Perfection V700 Photo Scanner goes one step further than typical home scanners. With its Dual Lens System, this innovative product automatically selects from two lenses for the desired scan resolution.




One–stop photo restoration solution 
The V700 Photo also offers a host of powerful tools for photo restoration. Digital ICE™ technologies is a unique combination of hardware and software for correcting image defects. Digital ICE for Film uses an infrared sensor to detect dust and scratches on the surface of the film. In a multi–pass process, the dust/scratch is mapped out and carefully removed from the scanned image, leaving the composition and quality intact. Digital ICE for Prints removes the appearance of many types of surface defects from prints, minimizing costly retouching.


DIGITAL ICE for Film – remove the appearance of dust and scratches for film Before After DIGITAL ICE for Prints – remove the appearance of tears and creases from damaged photos Before After Epson Easy Photo Fix® 
Restore faded color photos, slides and negatives, back to their original brilliance with Easy Photo Fix scanning technology, exclusively from Epson. Take those old family photos out of that shoebox in the closet and share precious moments once again. Just scan your photos renew the color with one click. It’s just that easy. In seconds, you’re ready to print and display those memories for all to enjoy. Along with color restoration, Easy Photo Fix also includes Grain Reduction and Backlight Correction.


Epson Easy Photo Fix – instantly restore color to old, faded photos Before After Increased productivity 
With the convenient film holders included, you can even batch scan multiple slides and negatives to increase productivity. This powerful performer gives you the industry’s leading scanner technologies, all right at your fingertips.


The 8" x 10" transparency unit (built into lid) has four film holders: 35mm negatives,
35mm slides, medium format and 4" x 5", 8" x 10" film area guide


Flexible Options, Comprehensive Software 
The Epson Perfection V700 Photo is compatible with both Macintosh and Windows operating systems, and includes FireWire and hi–speed USB 2.0 interfaces. Its comprehensive software package includes LaserSoft Imaging SilverFast SE 6, Adobe Photoshope Elements, ABBYY FineReader Sprint Plus OCR, Epson Copy Utility and Epson Scan with Epson Easy Photo Fix Technology. Epson also provides a one–year warranty covering parts and service.


Features/Benefits  * Optimize each scan with the exclusive Dual Lens™ System from Epson™ — Automatically selects from two lenses for desired scan resolution
 * Achieve professional quality scans — Delivers unparalleled performance with 6400 dpi optical resolution
 * Enjoy remarkable tonal range and greater shadow detail — Provides a 4.0 Dmax for smooth gradations and fine shadow detail
 * Remove dust and scratches from film and many types of surface defects from prints — Includes Digital ICE™ Technologies, so you can automatically remove dust and scratches, minimizing costly retouching
 * Batch scan multiple slides, negatives and medium–format film — Makes it easy to achieve greater productivity with convenient film holders
 * Dimensions (W x D x H) — 12" x 20" x 6" and Weight 14.5 lb




What the press is saying: "Eye–popping optical resolution of 6400dpi, a high maximum density of 4.0 and true 48–bit output allow this versatile letter–format flatbed scanner to deliver top–notch results at a reasonable price" Staff, American Photo (July/Aug 2006) "Having worked with high–quality photography throughout my life, I’m very demanding in terms of what I want in a final scan, and the V700 not only met, but often exceeded, my demands. It was a professional–quality scanner and produced extremely high–quality results – and thanks to the intelligence incorporated in the design of the scanner and the accompanying software, it also was easy to use." Ron Lafon, Cadalyst (8.5.2008) 


What’s in the Box 
 * Epson Perfection V700 Photo scanner – with DIGITAL ICE Technologies
 * 8" x 10" transparency unit (built into lid)
 * Four film holders: 35mm negatives, 35mm slides, medium format and 4" x 5"
 * 8" x 10" Film Area Guide
 * CD–ROM with Epson Scan software and productivity applications
 * DVD–ROM with Adobe® Photoshop® Elements
 * CD–ROM with LaserSoft Imaging™ SilverFast® SE6
 * Hi–Speed USB 2.0 cable
 * Epson Setup Sheet
 * AC adapter and power cable
